content: Mosque in Singapore **Masjid Taha**, or Taha Mosque (Arabic: مسجد طه) is a [mosque](/wiki/Mosque) in [Geylang](/wiki/Geylang), [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). It is the only mosque for the [Ahmadiyya Muslim Community](/wiki/Ahmadiyya_Muslim_Community) in the country. It is located at Onan Road, adjacent to Masjid Khalid, a mainstream mosque. Masjid Taha is one of two mosques in Singapore that are not administered by [Majlis Ugama Islam Singapura](/wiki/Majlis_Ugama_Islam_Singapura), due to the difference in religious beliefs between the [Ahmadiyya Muslim Community](/wiki/Ahmadiyya_in_Singapore) in Singapore and the [Singaporean Muslims](/wiki/Islam_in_Singapore) who are predominantly [Sunni](/wiki/Sunni) of the [Shafi'i](/wiki/Shafi%27i) school of thought. ## Transportation The mosque is accessible from [Paya Lebar MRT station](/wiki/Paya_Lebar_MRT_station). - [Islam in Singapore](/wiki/Islam_in_Singapore) - [Masjid Temenggong Daeng Ibrahim](/wiki/Masjid_Temenggong_Daeng_Ibrahim) This [Ahmadiyya](/wiki/Ahmadiyya)-related article is a stub. title: Masjid Taha
